section.name: Cell
section.definition: Specification of the recorded cell. A cell definition should be a subsection of the Subject section.

property.name: Type
property.definition: The type of the recorded cell. E.g. pyramidal cell.

property.name: BrainRegion
property.definition: The region the cell is located in. For example Retina, Cortex, Cerebellum etc.

property.name: BrainSubRegion
property.definition: More detailed specification of the region the cell is located in. For example, if BrainRegion is "hippocampus", then the BrainSubRegion may be "CA1".

property.name: Layer
property.definition: The name of the layer. For example, layer 4 in CA1.

property.name: Ganglion
property.definition: Like the pro-, meta- and mesothoracal ganglion in invertebrates.

property.name: Structure
property.definition: The structure of the organism the cell is located in e.g. Eye, Spinal cord...

property.name: RecordingLocation
property.definition: The recording location in the cell. E.g. axonal, dendritic, somatic, ...

property.name: RestingPotential
property.definition: What is the cells resting potential of the cell. An indiator for the recording quality.

property.name: BaselineRate
property.definition: For spiking cells, the spontaneous activity which might be an indicator for the cell's health status and thus recording quality.

property.name: BaselineNoise
property.definition: The standard deviation of the baseline membrane potential.

property.name: Rheobase
property.definition: The minimum current required to make the cell fire action potentials.

property.name: InputResistance
property.definition: The input resistance of the recorded cell.
